original_title: Sri Lanka’s new IGP to be appointed soon – Prime Minister
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); Sri Lanka's Prime Minister told Parliament on Friday (7) that the country's new Police Chief will be appointed within the next few hours, as per the powers vested with the President.

Prime Minister Dinesh Gunwardena pointed out that though there was a rush to pass the 21st constitutional amendment, to-date certain commissions have not been completely appointed, and the responsibility for such a situation should be shared by all as it has become a serious issue.

"The President granted an extension to the IGP, and the extension has expired. The President will announce his decision on the post of Police Chief to the relevant officials," said the Prime Minister, hinting that the appointment will be made within 48 hours.
He went on to note that the Deputy Inspector Generals of Police have been assigned to carry out the necessary duties to maintain the police service.
